come through the back gate, behind us you can see the

standing in is called Hero Square. The reason they call it that is
the two gentleman you can see on horseback, Prince Eugene
and Archduk Karl of Savoy and they were two millitary heros

Anyways we are going to see some horses.
Right now we are at Mauthausen concentration camp here in
Austria. It was used during the Holocaust. It is a big part of the
German Austrian history that you can't ignore when visiting
these countries. So we are not ignoring it, we are doing a little
history lesson and visiting one of the camps here. This is
actually one of the largest, most preserved concentration camps
and its also one of the most brutal concentration camps,
because there are 3 different levels you can have and this one
one was a work yourself to death camp. So, people that lived
here pretty much starved to death and worked themselves to
death and the owners of the camp profited from it. I don't really
want to go into details of what happen here. It is really brrutal.

We just watched a film on it. I 
 think it is very important to
acknowledge the past and to pay our respects. So that is what
we are doing.
